definition: to make discreet inquiries/to scout out
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: ShenXing smell speech flew into a rage and scolded Amy assume find out other peoples privacy.
sentences.chinese: 沈星聞言勃然大怒，訓斥艾米多管閒事打探他人隱私。

sentences.english: The king ordered his officers to inquire about the way, but failed to get any answer.
sentences.chinese: 國君派將士去打探，但沒有一個人能找到回去的道路。

sentences.english: You'd better stop him nosing about.
sentences.chinese: 你應該制止他到處打探的作法。

sentences.english: Shen Huaiyu sent out around the yuan has not accounted for the whereabouts of news.
sentences.chinese: 沈懷玉派人四處打探佔元下落，始終沒有消息。

sentences.english: I started asking around and people told me stories about the brick factories, " He said.
sentences.chinese: 我四處打探，人們告訴了我無數關於磚廠的事“他說。

sentences.english: He said, “No-comment” when the reporters asked him if the killer was arrested.
sentences.chinese: 當記者們打探是否捉到了兇手時，他說“無可奉告”。

sentences.english: I got to ask total strangers the things I'd always wanted to know.
sentences.chinese: 我向素不相識的人們打探我一直想知道的事。

sentences.english: Sometimes they hinted at marriage after a 10-minute talk.
sentences.chinese: 有時侯，聊上十分鐘她們就會打探豪厄爾的婚姻情況。

sentences.english: Females from both populations preferred males viewed through the UV-transmitting partition.
sentences.chinese: 在紫外線照射的環境下，2只母魚較爲喜歡打探公魚。
